name: AI Business Card
description: Development of the IBM AI Business Card features

values: Would you like to know about my qualifications?
If you have any further queries you can contact me via the contact details seen on this business card. Have an awesome day!
Would you like to know about my interests?
Would you like to know about my industry experience, projects that I’ve worked on, or both?
Would you like to know about my current role at IBM?

Recently I worked on a first of a kind cognitive search and rescue drone project. We created an autonomous search and rescue drone to identify those in need of recovery this was designed as a proof of concept for a partner to assist first responders in the event of an emergency. Other projects I’ve worked on include building a drone to mimic live disasters in a safe environment that could help emergency workers to make judgement about situations in the real world and bloomberg which was a first of a kind project used to explore the applications of IBMs UDP messaging for financial systems.

In industry I have worked in the defence and finance sectors alongside the likes of HSBC, Santander, Peoples bank of China, Bloomberg and the Royal air force. The roles I took on in these sectors revolved around consultancy encompassing secure messaging, integration and business process optimisation.

In industry I have worked in the defence and finance sectors alongside the likes of HSBC, Santander, Peoples bank of China, Bloomberg and the Royal air force. The roles I took on in these sectors revolved around consultancy encompassing secure messaging, integration and business process optimisation. For projects, recently I worked on a first of a kind cognitive search and rescue drone project. We created an autonomous search and rescue drone to identify those in need of recovery this was designed as a proof of concept for a partner to assist first responders in the event of an emergency. Other projects I’ve worked on include building a drone to mimic live disasters in a safe environment that could help emergency workers to make judgement about situations in the real world and bloomberg which was a first of a kind project used to explore the applications of IBMs UDP messaging for financial systems.
Would you like to know about some of the other roles i’ve taken on at IBM?

At the innovation centre my team utilises an array of technologies to help our Partners to innovate, including Watson, IoT, Messaging, Integration, Analytics and Cloud. The team enable and support our Partners throughout the development lifecycle, from design, implementation testing to marketing their innovations. Would you like to know about some of the other roles i’ve taken on at IBM?
Thanks, you’re awesome too!
Beyond work, I am an avid gamer, inventor and experimenter, I hugely enjoy competitive gaming, love problem solving and enjoy new experiences and technology.

The awards I have achieved are: IBM Excellence and Eminence Award 2012 and 2013, IBM European Tech Connect Winner 2012, 2013 and 2015, IBM technical rockstar 2014, 2015 and 2016, IBM social Business award 2014 and IBM patent achievement award 2016.

The qualifications I have achieved are: 2:1 in Information Systems Bsc, Certified WebSphere Application Server Specialist, Certified MQ Specialist and Senior Inventor. I have also achieved numerous awards, would you like me to tell you about them?

At the innovation centre I have a multi-faceted role. I provide leadership and direction to our technologists by defining and planning the innovation centres focus and goals. A significant part of my role is determining which technologies we will explore acquire or build so that both we and our partners can innovate and profit rapidly. Would you like to know about the innovation centre?

Roles that I have taken on here at IBM include; Information strategist and architect which involved designing and delivering information to support products, BPM consultant where I consulted with clients worldwide using BPM software to enhance gold standard business process methodologies and lastly, technical integration consultant in which I met with clients to discuss optimal methods to execute and integrate their business systems.
Sorry, I misheard you, could you try rephrasing for me?
Sorry, I didn't quite catch that, can you try wording your response differently?
Sorry, I misunderstood you, could you try a different response?
Welcome to my business card. I'm Jon Mcnamara, a senior inventor at IBM's innovation centre.
